stem: A 60-year-old patient who is on hormonal replacement therapy (HRT) for post-menopausal symptoms, developed recurrent episodes of vaginal bleeding. Which of the following is the best management option?
opt2: Stop HRT and proceed with endometrial biopsy
disc: Potential risks of hormone replacement following the menopause include endometrial cancer. Therefore any abnormal bleeding before or after initiating HR, warrants USS to assess endometrial thickness (<4mm) and endometrial sampling.
tags: Gynecology, Hormonal Replacement Therapy, Endometrial Cancer
